column4: how do I change the permissions on an external ZIP drive so I can unprotect it to load media onto it?
how do I change the permissions on an external ZIP drive so I can unprotect it to load media onto it?
when someone gets a minute, I need help with device permissions pleas
I have an external ZIP 100 drive...
does it have a fat32 file system on it
ok, so it has no permissions on it, so its being mounted read only, re-mount it read write as a test with the mount -o rw options instead of mount
so the text I type is /mount /dev/blahblahblah -o rw?
not quite mount -o rw blah blah not the other way around
you shouldn't have, ubuntu doesn't use root
you're helpful. is there a pluto client for ubuntu? if so what is it and where can I get it? :D
no idea. never heard of pluto
